messages.message:
Brian
Sikuli can do OS automation. So you could write a selenium script that makes a call to the sikuli web service that starts the iOS test script to interact in between selenium commands.

Oh sweet
I'm gonna have to dive in deeper on that

Brian
Yeah end to end integration testing. I am writing robots in selenium to automate checking accounts so I don't need an app for everything.

Brian

Brian
Still working on QA automation?

Brian
I have an activity that would make you master of the webdriver universe.

Hey man!
I would love to do that
I have transitioned to react dev at work but would be interested

Brian
I want to port this chromedriver to a JavaScript extension https://github.com/bayandin/chromedriver that guy copied it to GitHub because the dev repo is actually CVS ðŸ¤¢ it is very formulaic, anything with SendCommand is a call to this chrome API https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/ so all that is missing from a regular extension (no standalone server) is this http protocol https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/webdriver-spec.html then any QA person could record and playback their code with no extra add-ons or configuration, just copy paste and play automation scripts.

Brian
No extra browsers or pop-ups so it's easier to create test scripts, everything plays and clicks directly in the same window as your working in.
It could be used on a react app too. React is awesome.

Wow, Iâ€™m not at a computer right now bc weâ€™re out of town but I want to look into this as soon as I can. Sounds like it could be a god send for issues that sometimes make me want to run selenium headless
React is awesome I agree super powerful
Weâ€™re doing a drag and drop type editor like canva or publisher from the ground up right now
Harnessing their drag and drop
And redux is crucial for capturing and working with the state of items on the document
